solution_line_template: The offices ordered a total of {num_offices} offices * {sandwiches_per_office} sandwiches each = <<{num_offices}*{sandwiches_per_office}={office_sandwiches}>>{office_sandwiches} sandwiches.

So the group of customers must have ordered {total_sandwiches_made} total sandwiches - {office_sandwiches} sandwiches for the offices = <<{total_sandwiches_made}-{office_sandwiches}={group_sandwiches}>>{group_sandwiches} sandwiches.

This is a total of {group_sandwiches} sandwiches / {sandwiches_per_customer_in_group} sandwiches per customer = <<{group_sandwiches}/{sandwiches_per_customer_in_group}={customers_who_ordered}>>{customers_who_ordered} customers who ordered a sandwich.

As only half the group ordered a bacon sandwich, the entire group must have consisted of {customers_who_ordered} customers * {half_group_multiplier} = <<{customers_who_ordered}*{half_group_multiplier}={total_customers_in_group}>>{total_customers_in_group} customers.
